lexUnit.name: wake up.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: emerge from a state of sleep

sentence.text: I still wake up at night and think about Nelly Woodhouse .
It was n't until I woke up at three o'clock that I remembered my husband .
On the twenty seventh of December 1989 , I woke up at five o'clock .
But then again , have you ever woken up at two in the morning covered in sweat , with the absolute conviction that your time on the planet is about to run out ?
He 'd woken up at a quarter past four that morning to find Lavinia awake beside him , as often she was now in the middle of the night .
I wake up at night and I think of maybe some kid we 've been dealing with .
I thought I 'd woken up in Heaven .
She had been crying again and her mascara had been washed away and she looked like an eleven-year-old waking up in hospital after an operation .
I mean , I 'm still pleased , even at my old age , to wake up in the morning .
Graham woke up on the floor to find himself in handcuffs , and was taken to Headquarters , while Douglas hastily called a press conference .
Jessamy woke up on the morning of her twenty-fourth birthday and decided it was time she put her life in order .
Once she woke up crying .
I woke up screaming with terror and distress , and told my mother of the dream .
She now does yoga , and says that for the first time in her life she wakes up feeling calm and generally finds that thinking positively works .
Nina woke up feeling that something was wrong .
` The kids would wake up early and he would disappear under a pile of wrapping paper .
` When I woke up this morning I felt like death .
I woke up in bed the next morning with a strange feeling that something was wrong …
Dexter had woken up early only to find himself with forty minutes to kill .
I woke up about midnight .
She did not know that it had been spiked with tranquillisers until she woke up some time later .
Work habits ( such as waking up every day to an alarm clock ) that often flow over into responsible social attitudes ( such as being a good father ) are not being learnt .
